page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Quite near the school there is a farm called the East Law farm.There are 17 fields in East Law.On the farm there is a plough,a combine harvester,5 tractors and a machine for distributing the feed to the animals. There is 1 hired worker who helps the farmer,his son and wife to run the farm.They usually buy their cattle at local markets such as the ones at Lanark and Hamilton.In ten months one cow supplies 6000 litres of milk.There are two bulls,one dairy and one beef. The cows that supply beef have white heads.There are 400 cattle over all and 130 of them are Fresian cows which supply milk. It costs Â£2450 to feed all the animals a week. The farmer and his workers rise at 5a.m.each morning and finish work between 8 and 8.30.at night.
